channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023090388
item.description:
Report E-2023090388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and secure the tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-ounces of material released to the tote lid due to a loose cap. The released product was wiped up using simple green and absorbent rags. The cap was re-secured, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would no longer be a release in transit. The waste rags were then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090386
item.description:
Report E-2023090386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a NA1993 EC5627A release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and securement of the tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of material released to the tote body down all four sides and a 4” x 4” area of the dock floor due to a loose gasket. The released product was wiped up using simple green and absorbent rags. The gasket was re-secured, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would no longer be a release in transit. The waste rags were then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors were dispatched for the containment and clean up of the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that one pallet had fallen onto another pallet crushing 2 cases of drain opener (un1830) damaging 8 of the inner poly 1 gallon bottles and releasing 2 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report I-2023090042
item.description:
Report I-2023090042

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: Santa Clara
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Around 6:30am, the yard personnel were in the process of transferring containers to different trailers when they noticed a tote that might have a possible leak around the valve. They prepped an empty tote in the event there was a need to transfer the material out of the tote. Once they were all prepped, they checked the valve handle to make sure it was fully in the closed position. When the outlet cap was unscrewed, the material shot out of the valve due to a missing ball valve. Over half of the material was captured in the second tote and approximately 125 gals of the material released to the asphalt around the load dock. There was no release to the environment. The yard team quickly controlled the release with berms, absorbents, and vermiculite/floor dry and proceeded to clean up the material.

item.title: Report X-2023090013
item.description:
Report X-2023090013

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ONTARIO, CALIFORNIA, AN AIR PACKAGE WITH A VISIBLE PACKING LIST DISPLAYING AN E-SCOOTER DESCIPTION AND ADDITIONAL PREPRINTED PHANTOMGOGO MODEL R1 DESCRIPTIVE INFORMATION WAS STOPPED FOR CONTENT INSPECTION. INNER CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALED ONE PHANTOM R1 ELECTRIC SCOOTER WITH A LITHIUM ION BATTERY INSTALLED IN THE SCOOTER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was discovered with one of the exterior box sides wet and torn from internal leakage and subsequently removed from sort stream. Excess liquid was sopped up with absorbent materials , and the rest of the product was put into a plastic lined container . DescribePack: Two of the inner containers had loose caps on them. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by neutral absorbent material. The shipment was placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site .

item.title: Report E-2023090147
item.description:
Report E-2023090147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of isopropanol alcohol (UN1219) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged container of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 15-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090121
item.description:
Report E-2023090121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of bioside was damaged and released approximately its full contents to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon to remediate the impacted site. Ancon personnel deployed granular absorbents, absorbent pads, and utilized a pressure washer to the bioside-impacted roadway, trailer interior/exterior and freight. All spent absorbents, absorbent pads and damaged drum were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090083
item.description:
Report E-2023090083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee was offloading a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Richmond, CA and was staging the drums outside of the trailer prior to receiving the drums to the designated location. He was utilizing a forklift in which he was approaching 4 drums that were palletized. The employee did not realize that the pallet was not a standard size pallet and was not as deep. The forks exceeded the length of the pallet and hit the drum that was on the opposing side. The forks hit the drum roughly an inch above the bottom chime resulting in the drum getting damaged and a small pinhole leak occurred. The overall duration of the incident was a less than 10 minutes and it was determined that approximately 4 to 5 cups of material leaked out. The Veolia employees on site were able to contain the spill and place the damaged drum into a salvage drum.

While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent discovered that one of the plastic bottles inside had spilled its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The bottles were packaged with bubble wrap. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023061322
item.description:
Report X-2023061322

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2023 06 21 this HAZMAT shipment was observed leaking during deramping at that Stockton Intermodal Facility. Unit was placed in the hazpit for safekeeping until remediation was complete. Hazmat One was notified and they dispatched Patriot Environmental to inspect and remediate. Contractor arrived on property at approximately 13:00 to begin remediation. Upon exterior inspection, contractor observed a liquid, with a strong odor leaking at a rate of 4 5 drops per minute from the rear right corner of the trailer. Leaking liquid appears to be evaporating shortly after hitting the ground. Once door was opened, contractor observed a shipment of mixed freight, which included two pallets of metal drums loaded at the rear. Both pallets shifted toward the door, coming to rest against a load bar, which caused damage to four drums (two of which are leaking and identified in attached photos). It is estimated that a total of 2 quarts of product leaked from two drums. Product is identified as UN1247 // METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER, STABILIZED.

item.title: Report X-2023060815
item.description:
Report X-2023060815

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GBRX 702552 identified with release from top of car. BNSF Mechanical responders identified and secured 3 of 8 man way swing bolts to secure the release. The gasket was inspected for integrity and was found to be in a serviceable condition.
